newsitem.title: USA: TranSwitch and Harris & Jeffries enter pact.
newsitem.headline: TranSwitch and Harris & Jeffries enter pact.

text.p: TranSwitch Corp and Harris & Jeffries Inc said Wednesday they agreed to a strategic alliance whereby certain high-performance Soft-ATM software products developed by Harris will be ported to run on TranSwitch-developed VLSI devices.

TranSwitch will begin marketing Harris' software solutions, which will be fully integrated with TranSwitch's single-chip SARA-2 ATM segmentation and re-assembly device, along with its VLSI products during the fourth quarter of 1997.
Robert Pico, TranSwitch's vice president of business development, said "The availability of these software products should enable TranSwitch customers to further accelerate their time-to-market."
The two companies have agreed to work together to put additional Harris-developed software products to work seamlessly with other existing and future TranSwitch VLSI devices.
TranSwitch specializes in the design, development and the marketing of digital and mixed-signal semiconductor solutions for the telecommunications and data communications markets.
